title: Joseph de Maistre
summary: Joseph-Marie, comte de Maistre (French: [də mɛstʁ];[lower-alpha 1] 1 April 1753 – 26 February 1821)[2] was a Savoyard philosopher, writer, lawyer and diplomat who advocated social hierarchy and monarchy in the period immediately following the French Revolution.[3] Despite his close personal and intellectual ties with France, Maistre was throughout his life a subject of the Kingdom of Sardinia, which he served as a member of the Savoy Senate (1787–1792), ambassador to Russia (1803–1817)[4] and minister of state to the court in Turin (1817–1821).[5]
